result.execSummary:
The defendant Katie Rae McKusick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Katie Rae McKusick is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Katie Rae McKusick was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. DA: Michael Edward Nieskes Katie Rae McKusick pro se. Case called at 8:08. Includes 14CF119, 14CF384, 15CF191. Court reviews DE letter. DA Nieskes updates the Court. DE has completed treatment court. DA Nieskes will check to see if there have been any positive drug tests and would recommend STAYING the jail time for this year and have another review in a year. Agent is Terry Otratovic DE sees him once every 3 months. Next mtg will be in March. DE is working full time plus. DE attends a womens every Sat. and sees a therapist every week. Court STAYS conditional jail time that is ordered for THIS year.

records.addlTxt: Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. DA:  M. Nieskes. Katie Rae McKusick pro se. Agent J. Starkey. Case called at 3:42. Includes 14CF119, 14CF384, 15CF194. Court reviews file. ADA Nieskes responds and address a NC with and individual in drug court. Court reviews K. Kitzberger's letter. DA Nieskes requests modification of NC for drug court only. Court will modify the conditions of probation to allow contact in drug and family court only with Mr. Harrington. DA Nieskes responds modification of jail time. Court will not modify the 8 mo. condition time but will permit condition time as 1 mo. condition time (determined as 4 weeks) can be served in increments two weeks at a time.  The remainder of condition time will be stayed pending further review of the court.  DE  to serve an additional 40 hours of community service for 2017. DE to notify the agent by March 1 as to when condition time will be served.

from St. Croix County Health and Human Services re: update on DE. gme
SRN reviewed file on 01-03-2017. gme
filed by Kimberly Kitzberger w/SCC Drug Court to SRN. eif
c: Def, Atty, DA, NRPD & Jail. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Joseph R. Caton DF: Katie Rae McKusick appeared. Case called at 2:37. Includes 14CF384, 14CF119, 15CF191. Court reads maximum penalties and fines. Court has rec'd information from Dr. Moeller. Atty. Caton believes there are no corrections to the PSI. ADA Hartung makes recomendations. Atty. Caton makes recommendations. DE makes statement. Court orders: On 14CF119 I/S Total 6 years 0 months, Initial Confinement 3 years 0 months, ES 3 years 0 months
On 14CF119
4 years probation. Probation is concurrentto 14CF384 and 15CF191.
Conditions:
- 8 months St. Croix County Jail imposed, to be served 2 months per year of probation. 
  First jail term to commence no later than 60 days from 12-8-2015.
  Huber for workand/or child care. 
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Random and regular testing.
- DE to maintain full time employment.
- AODA and any recommended follow through.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- 80 hours of community service. 
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
- Costs including costs of supervision. 
- DE is to have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with Lloyd Robl and Josh Harrington except as it pertains to family court.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person. 
- DE to participate in St. Croix County drug court and will successfully complete program.
- DE to maintain mental health treatment, take all medication and make all appointments. 
Court notes 8 days credit against any ultimate sentence. 

On 14CF384 Court orders: Sentence I/S 6 years 0 months Total, 3 years 0 months Initial Confinement, 3 years 0 months ES
4 years probation concurrent to 14CF119 and same conditions

On 15CF191 
Court orders: Sentence  I/S 9 months County Jail concurrent to 14CF384 Ct. 1 and 14CF119 Ct. 2. 
same conditions as 14CF119 and 14CF384.


DE to report to probation by 4:00pm 12-09-2015.
If DE is revoke DE is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Matthew L Hartung  DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Katie Rae McKusick appeared. Case called at Includes 14CF119 (PLEAH), 14CM148, 14CF384, 15CF169, 15CF280, 15CF191 (all STC). ADA Hartung gives sentencing recommendations. Atty. Caton agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 2 in 14CF119 ,14CF384 and Ct. 3 in 15CF191. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in14CF119, 14CF384 and Ct. 3 in 15CF191. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1, 2 and 4 in 15CF191, 15CF280, 15CF169, 14CM148 and Ct. 1 in 14CF119. Court orders a PSI and Compass Assessment to be completed by 10-22-2015. Bond continues.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Katie Rae McKusick appeared. Case called at 4:26.  Includes 14CM148, 15CF169, 14CF384, 15CF191, 14CF119. ADA Hartung updates the court. 14CF119 if set for FPT today and requests the Court to extend the cut off for negotiations be one week prior to JT. Atty. Caton responds, there is a new charge 15CF280. Trial will remain. Negotiations will be extended to 08-17-2015. Witness lists, jury instuctions, motions in limine due on 08-18-2015.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Katie Rae McKusick appeared. Case called at 10:39. Includes 14CF119, 14CF384, 14CM148 all FPT, 15CF169, 15CF191. Court reviews files. ADA Hartung updates the court. Atty. Caton agrees to delay prelims on the 15 files for now. Cut off for negotiations will be Aug. 10, 2015. Address confirmed. Bond continues. Address confirmed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 04:30 pm.
